Reviews.Content: Very Good!!! This device is of great quality and very good price. Recommended. There are people who expect more, but for precione right.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding value
Reviews.Author: Helio
Reviews.Content: Does everything I wanted.  It browses, matches up to my Kindle and makes it very easy to share electronic photos with my parents.

Reviews.Title: Needs to be reset after charging, now just won't finish booting
Reviews.Author: Drei_Katzen "dreikatzen2004"
Reviews.Content: I loved everything except that it needed resetting after every charge, and now it just won't finish booting up. Junk. Less than a month old and it's trash.

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: Dave Crookes
Reviews.Content: Bought this because I like to read - A LOT. Call me Goldilocks - my smartphone was too small, my laptop was too big but the MeMO Pad is just right.  Not to mention a great buy at $89.95 from a quality manufacturer.  Plenty of apps are pre-loaded, many of them are the usual suspects, more than I will use on an on-going basis but I'll likely have some fun test driving them.

Reviews.Title: fun toy
Reviews.Author: bfromaway
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a trip that I was going on. I am not computer smart so I was a little frustrated with it at as I couldn't connect to the wi-fi at the airport, but I have learned how for the return trip. I still don't know how to take things off that I download then decide I don't want, but I am still learning. It is handy to stick in my purse. It shuts itself off if you aren't moving anything around but it comes right back up when hit the power button. Battery life seems to be good. Picture quality is good, sound is great. I have watches a few movies on it and haven't had any problems.

Reviews.Title: No bluetooth, GPS, and Slow...Oh my!!!
Reviews.Author: Charles Mcdonald "CHUCKSTA"
Reviews.Content: had this tablet for a month now, seller gave me the run around at store, only to find out it did have bluetooth and GPS, wifi was fine. But my biggest problem was that i couldnt tether using my phone as hotspot,  that put the nail in the coffin...why cant i tether? I would of gave it 4 stars if it would accept tethering, nope!!!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Jessica Smith
Reviews.Content: Really liking this tablet.  There is no instructions to use it but it is easy enough to figure out .  The white does not show at all if you put a roo case on it.  I wouldn't spend the extra for that again.

Reviews.Title: rating
Reviews.Author: Theresa A Peters
Reviews.Content: I thought when I purchase this I would get instruction that are able to do on my pad. I have only been able to put on the apps that I know about from my phone. I would think that it would be included in the packets

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: BrandonArt
Reviews.Content: I love this little guy. It's cheap, and it supports pretty much all the apps that I want to use, like Netflix. However, you'll come across several apps that don't work on this tablet, which can be a pain sometimes.The battery life is pretty good, too.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: jose luis
Reviews.Content: I like it very much,very fast,you have an ipad mini but chepear,and with thousands of apps i wll enjoy it

Reviews.Title: Ok Tablet
Reviews.Author: Norm
Reviews.Content: Couldn't get flash to install, no card slot to back load it, the only camera faces you,Returned unit, no hassles, customer service was excellent. Will buy a better one.

Reviews.Title: ASUS fan here
Reviews.Author: James Reid Sartin "Reisa"
Reviews.Content: Seeing this tablet on Amazon and having tested it out in the past -- I have to say that a sub $100 price is fantastic for it.  I debated between this and the 2013 Nexus 7, but went with the Nexus because I'm a performance junkie.  This won't be a techie's favorite tablet, but for kids, or older parents it would be great.  Especially anyone who's looking for a low-cost e-reader that can incorporate all of the major e-book platforms via apps (Kindle, Nook, Kobo, Google Books, etc.).

Reviews.Title: Good cheap tablet
Reviews.Author: Carlos Rico
Reviews.Content: It is a very good tablet for the price. If you are not looking to spend 400+ on a tablet then this is the one for you. It is good with browsing the web and watching movies.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my young nephew!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Price was right up my alley.  Purchased for my 3 year old nephew so I could get mine back from him.  Very easy to use.  Anyone old or young can figure out how to use it and enjoy.  Picture perfect!  Will purchase another one very soon.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for - 80 degree viewing angle
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I bought this for one purpose.  To test Android Apps that I wrote in a form factor smaller than a 10 inch tablet.So if it had any real capability beyond that, then it would just be gravy.I believe this "Memo Pad" was designed to be an E-Reader.  It's best viewing angle is vertical (like in the product photo) and looking at it straight on (actually about 80 degrees from the bottom).  Anything other than that it gets weird.  Go to 110 degrees from the bottom and you can't see the bottom part of the image.Rotate it to horizontal and the image takes on a weird 3 D effect.So if all you want is a Reader, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: nice gadget
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Does strange things at times, but overall, I like it fine.I mainly play games on it.I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Stoked! MeMo 172v is an Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: MarkC Cocoa Beach
Reviews.Content: Needed a budget tablet from a good brand. Uses will primarily be browsing and email, plus real estate listing demonstrations. On the business function the MeMo 172v is a little slow. I need my website to pop when demo'ing to prospects. But now I'll have to explain that tablet is a little slow. That is disappointing but not a big deal.Typical Asus quality throughout. Very impressed and mostly satisfied. Buy the Asus case with kick stand for best protection. Setup was as easy as it gets. It immediately updated the OS to 4.1.1. Enjoy.Update August 4, 2013:Well, let's just say I was stoked. After using the Asus MeMo 172V 7" tablet in the real world... not so stoked. BEWARE: Amazon lists the specs on this unit as having 2 processors. It does not. It is a single-core Cortex A9. There are dual-core Cortex A9 processors in the retail channel (kind of confusing), but this product does not have that CPU version. It is a single core computer. Might return it just on the basis of misrepresentation.

Reviews.Title: google map navigation and voice guidance.
Reviews.Author: Mohan
Reviews.Content: Is there any one who can help. I gifted to a friend who drives a taxi. The navigation menu on Google map is not available and so is voice guidance. Can any one help?

Reviews.Title: Love this Tab!
Reviews.Author: Joseph
Reviews.Content: Ordered this for myself cause I didnt want to pay the outrageous amount for an ipad, I am very pleased with this so far, quick, nice graphics and allows me to down load everything that i normally use except for instagram, which i am ok with. I ordered it friday afternoon and i was using it by noon saturday! Still cant believe how fast it was delivered!

Reviews.Title: ASUS MeMO Pad ME172V-A1-WH 7-Inch 16 GB Tablet
Reviews.Author: K. Adkins
Reviews.Content: Great little tablet for the money My wife loves it so easy to use and can play lots of games and apps. The 9in screen was a plus for her.Some say it lags at times but its not that bad and movies look great on it

Reviews.Title: Barely Usable
Reviews.Author: Stella C Klein
Reviews.Content: I know ASUS makes quality tablets, but this is not one of them. I currently have a 10" Acer that I love, but wanted something smaller.  Expected ASUS to provide an adequate 7" tablet just to do common web based apps like browsing, Facebook, radio and video apps.  It cannot handle any of this.  Browsing is painfully slow (found Opera Mini to be the best option) as Chrome and other full featured browsers hang. Videos start and stop, or just hang completely forcing a restart of app or a complete reboot of the tablet. If performance mode is selected (it does not make much difference) be prepared for laptop type battery life.  Where the Acer will go days without a charge, this goes hours, to maybe a day of on and off use. I guess if I considered the low cost of this tablet, I should have set my expectations a lot lower.  It is a good reader so based on that and low cost, I gave it an OK.I need to update my review of this tablet (3/9/14)to bump it up two stars! My biggest concern after I bought it was the horrible battery life and slow network speed. In January the battery died completely and would not accept a charge at all.  Asus honored their warranty and repaired the device in a timely manner with no hassle.  All I can say is WOW; night and day difference in battery life, wireless power and network speed.  I am very pleased with the device now as it can easily go three days (on and off use) without a charge.  It's fast and no longer has issues with video or browsers hanging up. I think I may even like it better than the Acer :-)

Reviews.Title: asus memo pad i like it a lot!
Reviews.Author: tornike kipiani
Reviews.Content: i both these moth a go it work just perfect, you get what you pay for ! even more .it's great it's cheap ! ! love it !

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: T. Heard "Ms. T Heard"
Reviews.Content: This is a great gift I bought it for my mom for mothers day she's in her mid 40's and it is great for her she loves it.

Reviews.Title: i love  it
Reviews.Author: scott m.
Reviews.Content: ilove this  my 3yr old loves  playing it easy to get around  now once the wifi hook up right i load  some games up for him

Reviews.Title: Great little tablet
Reviews.Author: Nan
Reviews.Content: It does everything I want it to do and for a good price. I like it better then the Samsung I had. As it has a card reader and I can put  games on a card and save room on the tablet.

Reviews.Title: Crashes on a weekly basis
Reviews.Author: bo diddly
Reviews.Content: I had nexus that got mangled and needed to replace. I got this hoping it would be almost as good. It had some annoying glitches and was really unresponsive. I was willing to just deal with it until one day it shut off and wouldn't turn back on even when plugged into the charger. IT wouldn't even register the the charger being connected. When it randomly turned back on, the battery wasn't even dead. I was led to believe it ran the newest version of android, which it doesn't. THat caused me some major issues.

Reviews.Title: I gave it away.
Reviews.Author: Will Alexandera
Reviews.Content: My initial review titles was "Disappointing", but the more I used the device, the less I liked it. I gave it away to someone that didn't have a tablet.The device is called a MeMO Pad, not an Android Tablet. As I understand it, Android tablets need to have a minimum number of features, like GPS and accelerometers. This device does not have a GPS.Because there is no GPS, Yelp, Ingress, and many other location dependent apps can't even be installed. Google navigation keeps showing "Searching for GPS" when it displays the route.Since I no longer own this device, I can't answer any more questions about it.I do recommend avoiding this device if you want a full featured Android Tablet.I am so disappointed with this purchase.I wish I had returned it within a week of receiving it.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price.
Reviews.Author: bryan wisniewski
Reviews.Content: I went from a Kindle fire 2nd generation to this tablet.  For the price it is top notch, it has ample storage space for apps and other data and although its not as peppy as a high priced tablet this one gets the job done.  perfect for web surfing and games that do not require a lot of processing power.  I highly recommend this product

Reviews.Title: OK budget Android tablet brought down completely by a horrid screen
Reviews.Author: L0st S0ul "Eric"
Reviews.Content: I originally bought this tablet to do some extra testing for my Android App FlightMap. Amazon was having what looked like an amazing deal on the tablet for only $80 so I thought how bad could it be right? Asus, the maker of the Nexus 7, makes it so it can't be to bad. It had good enough reviews so I picked one up.Opening the packaging was very promising. It was packaged very similarly to the new Nexus 7 even including the same charger and cable. It was right away clear that the tablet was very similarly sized to the Nexus 7 while the screen area was noticeably smaller width. Height wise they looked the same. This difference in screen size is why I bought it. I needed the different aspect ratio to test the app with. The tablet screen also has an almost grey look to it that I didn't notice until I sat it next to the Nexus 7.Hardware spec wise it's a pretty base tablet. It has a single core A9 processor with 1 gig of ram and a separate GPU. It has a front and rear camera but neither are anything to write home about. The one nice thing that it has is a Micro SD slot. This is something missing on the Nexus 7 and it's nice to see it here. All of this is serviceable and the tablet actually performs quite well on android 4.2 (update came down after start-up and updated it from 4.1). YouTube videos played OK and Netflix also worked well. I didn't see any sync issues like others noted. It's not a speedy tablet by any means but it was better than I was expecting for a single core device. It only has a single core so expect hiccups if you're doing several things at once.Where the tablet falls down completely is the screen. Most of these cheap tablets make sacrifices and unfortunately for this one it was the screen. This has to be the worst screen I have ever seen on a tablet. The viewing angles are atrocious and the colors are completely washed out from any angle. I could not find a comfortable angle to view the screen at that I could see all 7 inches of screen at the same time. It almost has this polarizing effect on the eyes that caused me a horrible headache after minutes of use. The resolution does it no favors either. A 3 year old Archos 7 tablet not only had better viewing angles than this tablet but somehow the text look better on it at the same time even though they are the same resolution (1024x600).If the screen was as good as the Archos was 3 years ago I'd be able to recommend it but as it sits no way. Maybe my eyes are more sensitive than others but to me it makes the tablet completely unusable which is why the 1 star.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the $
Reviews.Author: Aimee Paynter
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet because it sounded like it would be able to do everything I needed it to do.  Wrong.  Half the apps I needed to install for work were not supported.  I returned it for a refund and got a Hisense Pro 7 at Wal-Mart for $130 which did allow me to add the apps I wanted/needed with NO PROBLEM.  This tablet is probably great for a teen or as a first tablet, but definitely not what I expected from reading the reviews....

Reviews.Title: Asus Memo Pad
Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: This is lightweight and easy to carry yes, but does not run well. Poor battery life, apps are constantly glitching, requiring a force shutdown. Screen rotation messes up and does not save selected battery power mode, auto switches back to high power. Not worth purchasing.

Reviews.Title: Tablets will not load paid items from Play store do not buy
Reviews.Author: Cooper Family
Reviews.Content: Our kids bought these tablets and the tablets will not load paid apps from the play store.  ASUS the company has no resolution and is blaming the problem on Google but these apps work with other android devices.  I do not recommend this item.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Coming from a dell streak 7 this thing is amazing. Great touch response, bright screen, quick processor. Some complain about coming from an ipad, well if you need to reason that out your not to quick. The important thing with this device is to use the Task Manager widget which lets you close apps that are running in the background and to go into the settings and turn off wi-fi on while sleeping.

Reviews.Title: only 1 camera
Reviews.Author: David G. Williams "deepster"
Reviews.Content: 0nly 1 camera on this rig. battery life sucks. should have spent more money on a better unit. peace out.

Reviews.Title: Sub-par tablet that has no reason to exist.
Reviews.Author: A. Gorshenin
Reviews.Content: I have been using this tablet for 2 days now. I do own first generation iPad and Kindle Fire 1st gen. (which was rooted to Android 4.2 version). The number 1 reason I bought this tablet is that it was on sale for $89 and it had web can (I use Skype a lot) and expandable memory that my other 2 tablets didn't have. I was hoping that with more RAM (1 GB) and web can it will replace my old Kinlde Fire as a primary Android device. Well.... I really tried to like it keeping in mind how little I paid for it but TERRIBLE screen and short battery life plus very sluggish performance comletelly ruined it for me. The screen is a deal breaker. It gave me headache trying to read webpages, I actually got nauseous and with double of RAM compared to my Kindle it is actually slower. Web page scrolling is  jerky which I never seen before on other tablet. In addition I couldn't install some of my apps that I have installed on kindle from Google Play store as it stated that the app isn't compatible with the device... that's was very unexpected.Bottom line, I wouldn't buy it having known what I know about this device now.

Reviews.Title: Froze up after two weeks
Reviews.Author: T. W. Staton
Reviews.Content: Worked great for two weeks. The pads' screen froze at the asus logo and wouldn't continue. Called asus support and they tried several resets over the phone. This didn't work so I had to send it back for repairs. The support team at asus is great. I followed the instructions they gave me and sent it back. Within 7 days I had the unit back. It is still working.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as it sounds!
Reviews.Author: UnSatisfied
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift and I was really excited (about a wk ago). First off it has no camera unless I want a picture of myself since it is only front camera. (Sucks!) Then it is not bluetooth compatible. And now I've realized I can't download apps for important things like Bank of America, Groupon and a lot more. Sad! Yes it is good for most games and it does run good (reason why I didn't give it a lower star) But its worth spending $40 more and getting a different device.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the value
Reviews.Author: Ismael Al-Omari "Obstacles are what you see w...
Reviews.Content: Good tablet in general, but add 10-15% more and you can get a better Acer or even Samsung Tab 2!I realized too late (after making the order) that it had no back-camera and only a front one with low megapixels!OK for kids I guess.Satisfied for the special price I got it for...

Reviews.Title: Tablet
Reviews.Author: being loki
Reviews.Content: Remember Honda and Toyota back in the 90's???  It was cheap but exceptionally well made.  Great buy if you don't want to spend what competitors are asking.

Reviews.Title: you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: joshua james
Reviews.Content: Came after the estimated date. when it finally came it was a pretty decent little tablet. Jellybean os doesnt make the tablet run any smoother. Still a lot of lag. Power button stopped working last week and none of my movies recorded on my phone plays on this. Wish they let me give 0 stars. would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: Descontento
Reviews.Author: Beto
Reviews.Content: Very unhappy about this purchase because the item never arrived, buy two tablets equal and only one came, disappointed I never thought this could happen, the buy to give as a gift to my children, now do not know if I came back the or not to create controversy to sell it with my children, I will try as far as possible not to buy around here if I am not resolve the problem, the same problem I am presenting with some cases for these tablets coincidentally had the same tracking

Reviews.Title: It is not what i expected
Reviews.Author: Cathy Mendoza
Reviews.Content: the camara's lent is only facing me.  it is very uncomfortable trying to catch the view you want.  that's it

Reviews.Title: 7 in tablet asus
Reviews.Author: tompete "teepee"
Reviews.Content: Very handy size for glove box when going anywhere. Have (10 ")  also for more reading & other aps that require more room

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: MKP52
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love it. Bought it as a gift for my cousin. The responsive is simply amazing. I'm happy to have made a good choice.

Reviews.Title: 7" Asus Tablet
Reviews.Author: Kathy Didday "Kathy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for a dear friend.  I was out of town when it arrived & she text me & told me that she hadn't been able to put it down since she got it!  She absolutely loves it!

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: J. Rosado
Reviews.Content: Bought it as a gift for my stepmom. She really likes it, light weight, fast, beautiful screen.Easy set up and quick wi-fi connectivity.

Reviews.Title: Cannot watch videos on this! Read the description CAREFULLY
Reviews.Author: Sarah Stewart
Reviews.Content: I bought this as something my 2yo could play with and watch videos. However, it did NOT say in the reviews that it does not have the software needed to watch videos!! So I feel like its kind of pointless!

Reviews.Title: No LED for power on or charge indication = not acceptable based on my review comments
Reviews.Author: jmclr
Reviews.Content: I received my MeMo pad today. Opened the package and statred charging. There is no LED to show charge level. The unit was in On position. Manual says charge for 8 hours before use. AT THE SAME TIME IT SAYS IT SHOULD NOT BE LEFT CONNECTED TO POWER SUPPLY FOR EXTENDED PERIOD OF TIME. IT IS NOT DESIGNED THAT WAY. To that is a big black mark.I will provide more reviews later on.I bought it for one reason low price - it dropped to under $105 yesterday - It is more like Kindle Fire with slot for micro SD card and 16 G internal memory. I do own a Kindle Fire for last 16 months ago - I bought it for her birthday last year - She love her KindleAnother problem can not use sites using adobe flash player like Amazon prime videos

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: elham daneshfar
Reviews.Content: I didn't have any problem till now.I downloaded a lot of games and ebook in there for my daughter.I was happy.

Reviews.Title: Bad product
Reviews.Author: Pearlz
Reviews.Content: Screen froze and sent in to have ASUS fix it.  They told me that the screen had cracked.  Puzzled as tablet was never dropped or handled harshly.  Disappointment in ASUS customer support and product.  Since it was not under warranty, I was told I would have to pay to get it fix.  It will cost me twice as much to fix it from my purchase price.  Would not recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: horrible
Reviews.Author: aslam mohammed
Reviews.Content: very very slow processing, won't suggest it for any one.very very slow processing, won't suggest it for any one.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Ardis Jackson Jr. "whatage"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my daughter. She loves it. It works just like it's was described. I plan to upgrade later.

Reviews.Title: I hate it, be very careful and watch the pictures displayed, no rear camera and front camera is very poor
Reviews.Author: Dh
Reviews.Content: I hate it, be very careful and watch the misleading pictures displayed on amazon.com, no rear camera and front camera is very poor quality, worse than old web cams, in any light

Reviews.Title: Not Too Much Battery Life
Reviews.Author: Francisco
Reviews.Content: I bought an Asus Memo Pad not too long ago and i started using it right away after i got it but it discharges too fast, the Asus Memo Pad doesn't have too much battery life. I don't like it.

Reviews.Title: Arrived Broken/ Zero customer service
Reviews.Author: T. Sappia
Reviews.Content: It came with a broken screen.Sent it back but had to pay for postage.  Still took several days for the refund. Tried looking for a contact number to call Amazon. Have you ever tried to reach Amazon and talk to a customer service person??  Ha! Good luck.  Just give it a try sometime.I used to love Amazon and I used them all the time.  Next time I 'll just drive down to my local BestBuy or Costco where at least I have a chance to get an issue resolved. Oh...also, I ordered a Kindle Fire to replace this broken one. I kept looking daily to see if it had shipped and it said it had not been shipped yet...then this morning we looked and the entire order was gone from my account.  no reference that it was even placed.  ugh.  Best of luck.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: Kokorozashi
Reviews.Content: All in all, the MeMO pad is a fairly good quality tablet considering the price. However, if you drop it, expect to replace it. I had this thing about two weeks and was waiting on a case, which unfortunately was coming from the UK. Before it got here, I managed to drop it a couple feet onto a hard surface when it slipped out of my bag. It looked perfectly fine, but something inside got cracked or disconnected, because now the screen is just colors and lines.ASUS customer service is friendly in that disinterested, unhelpful way of most technical service these days. Apparently that repair is not covered under the warranty, even though while they had me on hold the hold message said that the warranty covered one case of accidental damage per machine. This was never quite explained, but whatever: so I ask for an estimate of how much it will cost to get it repaired. The estimate they gave me was $180 (not including shipping). Note that this is a $100 tablet. I was stunned that anyone could even utter such a thing without feeling stupid.I'm going to see if there's any other way to repair it, but I can say that I will not be buying an ASUS product again. The accident was just bad luck, but the surreal experience with customer service has put me off this company entirely.

Reviews.Title: it's fine if you want to give it to a child
Reviews.Author: Gen "GG"
Reviews.Content: If you want to get this to entertain children it's fine. If you want Instagram, don't get this. If you have any apps in mind, first look up to see which devices are compatible.

Reviews.Title: Pathetic
Reviews.Author: bartendme
Reviews.Content: I advise against purchasing this. I had exams to study for, and purchased it so I could read websites, etc. while travelling. First out of the box, my very first attempt at a connection was slow. Not connection wise, as I was connected to a strong wifi signal. Literally, my Samsung S3 is FAR more powerful than this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Don't consider this review
Reviews.Author: Adam Gagnon
Reviews.Content: I bought this product because I have a 7'' kindle fire and like the size. This tablet was meant to replace my mothers laptop. I returned the item without opening it to get her the kindle fire 8.9'' when I found out such a thing existed. The return wasn't a negative to this product I just went in a different direction.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS DEVICE!!!!
Reviews.Author: Michael M. Stewart
Reviews.Content: At first I thought this device to be a great on the go reader, but I was very wrong when I received the device I turned it on without any problems but after a system update failure the device kept telling me that "No USB cable connected". I don't know what that exactly means but it would not boot up into the Android OS. I returned the device for another one, had the same issue after an update. I do not know what exactly I did wrong in the update part but it failed the second time on the replacement device. I have owned an ASUS Transformer TF101 and never had any issues updating it, but for some reason this device gave me issues. Now it could be just a cheap piece of junk due to it being so low in price, I don't really know. Now the ASUS Transformer TF101 was very expensive and maybe that is the difference. If you want low end junk then this device is for you and if you want a stable and non problematic device then this is not for you. Other people's experiences may vary with this device, but with me it was very distasteful.

Reviews.Title: good tablet
Reviews.Author: Parviz
Reviews.Content: It is a pity that is not present wifi direct. I do not know now as to throw off the information from a tablet on a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Does not suport flash Player
Reviews.Author: Tdc1ben
Reviews.Content: Though this was a well made Tablet at a very reasonable price. After getting it & testing it for a few days I found out it was not.You cant watch Net flick or some You tube videos as it does not support plash player witch most online videos use now days.I cant believe that ASUS would put out such a product. If they are it should be stated that the tablet I not for use with watching videos & some other apps wont run on this tablet. I cant use my Walgreens app witch I use for ordering all my medications each month & I use Pay Pal app for paying for items that I have bought. The apps are much easier than having to login the web site & deal with what I need to take care in my daily life. I got an RMA to return the item & I hope that they don't try to hit me for the 15% restocking fee as not my fault that the item does not do what all other Tablets do & that is play flash videos.

Reviews.Title: The worst decision i have ever made
Reviews.Author: M. Elwrayeth "Rasta Squad"
Reviews.Content: Yeah i thought to myself it is cheap, and it is for the girls to play with, but even so it sucks badly, very slow, can not run trending games, has no bluetooth, 4 or 5 apps in background you forget about running anything else, do a hard reset :( , very disappointed, i should've added extra 70 $ and went for Google nexus , stay away you will regret it too.

Reviews.Title: Very poor screeen quality
Reviews.Author: EFRAIN RAMIREZ JIMENEZ
Reviews.Content: I bought and I retorned it, because of the poor quality. I don't recommend it. but if you prefer read more feed backs.
